Title: Memories at UCSC West Side
Credits: Created by Adam Smith (amsmith@ucsc.edu). Edited by Jose Salas (jssalas@ucsc.edu)

Redwood Grove.Body:
These are the Redwood Grove Apartments. 
I had met a transfer student who invited me over once to their apartment, 
but things sort of fell off and it reminded me that people come and go even if you got along.

Kresge.Body:
This is Kresge College, probably the college with the most sister bridges. 
I had a call here with one of the CAPS officials during a time of crisis during my Sophomore year. 
Seeing construction workers across one of the bridges reminded me that people can be break, 
including myself, and reconstructing is very similar to healing from pain.

Porter.Body:
This is Porter College, the one I'm affiliated with. 
Back in Freshman year I was worried about it raining because my High School Micro Econ teacher informed me about the Porter Run. 
I did not participate when it did happen, but I had the misfortune of seeing people naked out in the freezing rain. 
Although it reminded me that there are moments in life where risks and crazy decisions can be fun.

Rachel Carson.Body:
Here at Rachel Carson College, 
the dining hall stayed open most nights for Late Night Dinner which fit my schedule amazingly during Freshman year. 
I had many great memories with a couple of international friends I made before the place got shut down. 
It reminds me that I need to cherish the good times I have and not take things for granted, 
especially when you're in an unfamilar place.

Oakes.Body:
Oakes College, where you get students who shout out their own college name like a bunch of apes. 
Strangely enough it's not the prettiest looking college, but I guess you can't judge a book by its cover.

Beyond.Body:
And beyond there's more than just grass. 
The fields open up and you can the ocean. 
It reminds me that despite all the crap we go through, 
the world can be beautiful and there's a reason for why I am here today.
